clinical_study.brief_title: Surgical Face Mask Effects in Patients With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Surgical Face Mask on Submaximal Exercise Test in Patients With COVID-19

lead_sponsor.agency: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

clinical_study.source: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

brief_summary.textblock: The use of personal protective equipment is mandatory for healthcare workers caring patient with COVID-19. To maximise the reduction of virus spread during clinical procedures involving the presence of healthcare workers, it is also recommended to patients to wear surgical facemask. Routine clinical procedures include cardio-pulmonary and strengthening exercises. During these exercises, the wearing of a face mask may be difficult to tolerate by patients, especially since they experience breathing difficulties due to the illness. Therefore, this study aims to verify the effects of the surgical facemask on breathing difficulties and exercise performance during a 1-minute sit to stand test.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Before, immediately after and 2 minutes after the sit-to-stand test
primary_outcome.description: The Modified Borg dyspnea scale will be used to estimate dyspnea This scale range from 0 (no dyspnea) to 10 (maximal dyspnea)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, immediately after and 2 minutes after the sit-to-stand test
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate will be measured using two inductive plethysmography belts

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, immediately after and 2 minutes after the sit-to-stand test
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate will be measured using a pulse oximeter

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, immediately after and 2 minutes after the sit-to-stand test
secondary_outcome.description: SpO2 will be measured using a pulse oximeter
The number of repetitions will be manually counted

arm_group.description: The surgical facemask will be worn during the sit-to-stand test
No facemask will be worn during the sit-to-stand test

intervention.description: The 1-minute sit-to-stand test will be realized with or without a surgical facemask covering the face of the patient with COVID-19

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hospitalized for COVID-19
- No need of supplemental oxygen during the procedure (i.e. SpO2 of 96% or higher in ambient air)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Altered state of consciousness
- Respiratory co-morbidities
- Neurological or orthopedic co-morbidities susceptible to alter the reliability of the sit-to-stand test
- Having required high flow nasal cannula or non-invasive ventilation during the hospital stay
